segment.source: Working with line-of-business apps (Windows 10)
segment.target: Working with line-of-business apps (Windows 10)

segment.source: Your company can make line-of-business (LOB) applications available through Windows Store for Business.
segment.target: Your company can make line-of-business (LOB) applications available through Windows Store for Business.

segment.source: These apps are custom to your company – they might be internal business apps, or apps specific to your business or industry.
segment.target: These apps are custom to your company – they might be internal business apps, or apps specific to your business or industry.

segment.source: Working with line-of-business apps
segment.target: Working with line-of-business apps

segment.source: Applies to
segment.target: Applies to

segment.source: Windows 10
segment.target: Windows 10

segment.source: Windows 10 Mobile
segment.target: Windows 10 Mobile

segment.source: Your company can make line-of-business (LOB) applications available through Windows Store for Business.
segment.target: Your company can make line-of-business (LOB) applications available through Windows Store for Business.

segment.source: These apps are custom to your company – they might be internal business apps, or apps specific to your business or industry.
segment.target: These apps are custom to your company – they might be internal business apps, or apps specific to your business or industry.

segment.source: Developers within your own company, or ISVs that you invite, can become LOB publishers and submit apps to the Windows Store for your company.
segment.target: Developers within your own company, or ISVs that you invite, can become LOB publishers and submit apps to the Windows Store for your company.

segment.source: Once a LOB publisher submits an app for your company, the app is only available to your company.
segment.target: Once a LOB publisher submits an app for your company, the app is only available to your company.

segment.source: LOB publishers submit apps through the Windows Dev Center using the same process as all apps that are in the Store, and then can be managed or deployed using the same process as any other app that has been acquired through the Store.
segment.target: LOB publishers submit apps through the Windows Dev Center using the same process as all apps that are in the Store, and then can be managed or deployed using the same process as any other app that has been acquired through the Store.

segment.source: One advantage of making apps available through Store for Business is that the app has been signed by the Store, and uses the standard Store policies.
segment.target: One advantage of making apps available through Store for Business is that the app has been signed by the Store, and uses the standard Store policies.

segment.source: For companies that can’t submit their application through the Windows Dev Center (for example, those needing additional capabilities or due to compliance purposes), Sideloading is also supported in Windows 10.
segment.target: For companies that can’t submit their application through the Windows Dev Center (for example, those needing additional capabilities or due to compliance purposes), Sideloading is also supported in Windows 10.

segment.source: Adding LOB apps to your private store
segment.target: Adding LOB apps to your private store

segment.source: Your Store for Business admin and ISV each own different parts of the process for getting LOB apps created, submitted, and deployed to your employees.
segment.target: Your Store for Business admin and ISV each own different parts of the process for getting LOB apps created, submitted, and deployed to your employees.

segment.source: They’ll use the Store for Business portal, and the Windows Dev center on MSDN.
segment.target: They’ll use the Store for Business portal, and the Windows Dev center on MSDN.

segment.source: Here’s what’s involved:
segment.target: Here’s what’s involved:

segment.source: The Store for Business admin invites a developer or ISV to become an LOB publisher for your company.
segment.target: The Store for Business admin invites a developer or ISV to become an LOB publisher for your company.

segment.source: LOB publisher develops and submits app to the Store, tagging the app so it is only available to your company.
segment.target: LOB publisher develops and submits app to the Store, tagging the app so it is only available to your company.

segment.source: The Store for Business admin accepts the app and can distribute the app to employees in your company.
segment.target: The Store for Business admin accepts the app and can distribute the app to employees in your company.

segment.source: What you'll have to set up:
segment.target: What you'll have to set up:

segment.source: Your company needs to be signed up with Store for Business.
segment.target: Your company needs to be signed up with Store for Business.

segment.source: LOB publishers need to have an active developer account.
segment.target: LOB publishers need to have an active developer account.

segment.source: To learn more about account options, see Ready to sign up.
segment.target: To learn more about account options, see Ready to sign up.

segment.source: LOB publishers need to have an app in the Store, or have an app ready to submit to the Store.
segment.target: LOB publishers need to have an app in the Store, or have an app ready to submit to the Store.

segment.source: Add an LOB publisher (Store for Business Admin)
segment.target: Add an LOB publisher (Store for Business Admin)

segment.source: For developers within your own organization, or ISVs you're working with to create LOB apps, you'll need to invite them to become a LOB publisher.
segment.target: For developers within your own organization, or ISVs you're working with to create LOB apps, you'll need to invite them to become a LOB publisher.

segment.source: To invite a developer to become an LOB publisher
segment.target: To invite a developer to become an LOB publisher

segment.source: Sign in to the Windows Store for Business.
segment.target: Sign in to the Windows Store for Business.

segment.source: Click Settings, and then choose LOB publishers.
segment.target: Click Settings, and then choose LOB publishers.

segment.source: On the Line-of business publishers page, click Add to complete a form and send an email invitation to a developer.
segment.target: On the Line-of business publishers page, click Add to complete a form and send an email invitation to a developer.

segment.source: Note This needs to be the email address listed in contact info for the developer account.
segment.target: Note This needs to be the email address listed in contact info for the developer account.

segment.source: Submit apps (LOB publisher)
segment.target: Submit apps (LOB publisher)

segment.source: The developer receives an email invite to become an LOB publisher for your company.
segment.target: The developer receives an email invite to become an LOB publisher for your company.

segment.source: Once they accept the invite, they can log in to the Windows Dev Center to create an app submission for your company.
segment.target: Once they accept the invite, they can log in to the Windows Dev Center to create an app submission for your company.

segment.source: The info here assumes that devs or ISVs have an active developer account.
segment.target: The info here assumes that devs or ISVs have an active developer account.

segment.source: After an app is published and available in the Store, ISVs publish an updated version by creating another submission in their dashboard.
segment.target: After an app is published and available in the Store, ISVs publish an updated version by creating another submission in their dashboard.

segment.source: Creating a new submission allows the ISV to make the changes required to create a LOB app for your company.
segment.target: Creating a new submission allows the ISV to make the changes required to create a LOB app for your company.

segment.source: To learn more about updates to an app submission, see App submissions and Distributing LOB apps to enterprises.
segment.target: To learn more about updates to an app submission, see App submissions and Distributing LOB apps to enterprises.

segment.source: To create a new submission for an app
segment.target: To create a new submission for an app

segment.source: Sign in to the Windows Dev Center, go to your Dashboard, and click the app you want to make available as an LOB app.
segment.target: Sign in to the Windows Dev Center, go to your Dashboard, and click the app you want to make available as an LOB app.

segment.source: On the App overview page, under Action, click Update.
segment.target: On the App overview page, under Action, click Update.

segment.source: -OR-
segment.target: -OR-

segment.source: Submit your app following the guidelines in App submissions.
segment.target: Submit your app following the guidelines in App submissions.

segment.source: Be sure to completed steps 3 and 4 when you set app pricing and availability options.
segment.target: Be sure to completed steps 3 and 4 when you set app pricing and availability options.

segment.source: On the Pricing and availability page, under Distribution and visibility, click Line-of-business (LOB) distribution, and then choose the enterprise(s) who will get the LOB app.
segment.target: On the Pricing and availability page, under Distribution and visibility, click Line-of-business (LOB) distribution, and then choose the enterprise(s) who will get the LOB app.

segment.source: No one else will have access to the app.
segment.target: No one else will have access to the app.

segment.source: Under Organizational licensing, click Show options.
segment.target: Under Organizational licensing, click Show options.

segment.source: Organizational licensing options apply to all apps, not just LOB apps:
segment.target: Organizational licensing options apply to all apps, not just LOB apps:

segment.source: Store-managed (online) volume licensing - This is required.
segment.target: Store-managed (online) volume licensing - This is required.

segment.source: You must select this item to make your app available as an a LOB app.
segment.target: You must select this item to make your app available as an a LOB app.

segment.source: By default, it will be selected.
segment.target: By default, it will be selected.

segment.source: This won't make the app available to anyone outside of the enterprise(s) that you selected in Distribution and visibility.
segment.target: This won't make the app available to anyone outside of the enterprise(s) that you selected in Distribution and visibility.

segment.source: Disconnected (offline) licensing - This is optional for LOB apps.
segment.target: Disconnected (offline) licensing - This is optional for LOB apps.

segment.source: Click Save to save your changes and start the app submission process.
segment.target: Click Save to save your changes and start the app submission process.

segment.source: For more information, see Organizational licensing options and Distributing LOB apps to enterprises.
segment.target: For more information, see Organizational licensing options and Distributing LOB apps to enterprises.

segment.source: Note In order to get the LOB app, the organization must be located in a supported market, and you must not have excluded that market when submitting your app.
segment.target: Note In order to get the LOB app, the organization must be located in a supported market, and you must not have excluded that market when submitting your app.

segment.source: Add app to inventory (admin)
segment.target: Add app to inventory (admin)

segment.source: After an ISV submits the LOB app for your company, the Store for Businessadmin needs to accept the app.
segment.target: After an ISV submits the LOB app for your company, the Store for Businessadmin needs to accept the app.

segment.source: To add the LOB app to your inventory
segment.target: To add the LOB app to your inventory

segment.source: Sign in to the Store for Business.
segment.target: Sign in to the Store for Business.

segment.source: Click Manage, and then choose New LOB apps.
segment.target: Click Manage, and then choose New LOB apps.

segment.source: Click the ellipses under Action for the app you want to add to your inventory, and then choose add to inventory.
segment.target: Click the ellipses under Action for the app you want to add to your inventory, and then choose add to inventory.

segment.source: After you add the app to your inventory, you can choose how to distribute the app.
segment.target: After you add the app to your inventory, you can choose how to distribute the app.

segment.source: For more information, see:
segment.target: For more information, see:

segment.source: Distribute apps to your employees from the Windows Store for Business
segment.target: Distribute apps to your employees from the Windows Store for Business

segment.source: Distribute apps from your private store
segment.target: Distribute apps from your private store

segment.source: Assign apps to employees
segment.target: Assign apps to employees

segment.source: Distribute offline apps
segment.target: Distribute offline apps
